channel.title: Things that bother you about forum software
channel.description:
I'm quite annoyed by a lot of things in the forum software available these days and so I decided to write my own 'perfect' one.
I'm interested in finding out what others [b]don't like/are annoyed by[/b] and what they [i]would want to see[/i] in forum software.

item.title: Things that bother you about forum software
item.dc:creator: @Wrauld Wrauld
item.description:
@Wrauld wrote:

SMF - Layout sucks.
PhpBB - Great themes, more for the more ‘experinced’ (<-- spelled wrong =/) users.

How about combine them both. Make one with the features of smf, but contain good themes.

If you want a good smf theme, you have to edit it your self which is easy, but its harder to make a really decent looking theme.

Read full topic
item.source: Things that bother you about forum software

item.description:
@lawl wrote:

users cant choose to use a style unless its installed. generally its not a problem, but theres not a single good theme on this forum

item.title: Things that bother you about forum software
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

I have noticed most people would need a forum that is so easy to customize, (and the customization is so open ended) that it should be able to look exactly like their site (or be integrated into it somehow), there is nothing worse than having a site then a link to another part of your site which looks completley different. (, no offence moparisthebest)

Read full topic

item.title: Things that bother you about forum software
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I like everything about Fluxbb, except not having Personal Message System in the core package. I like the simplicity of the design mostly. I like Invision Power Board 1.3.1 because that’s the first forum software I used, and it worked great. It taught me about css, and html. I like smf because of the large extension and styles community behind it. I like Phpbb because of it’s innovative ideas, and the large community backing it as well.

What I want is a very simple Forum Software, that I can choose the packages to install with it before I download it. Like Firefox’ new ad campaign. I can choose the mods/extensions/themes, I want to be able to do that. I want to be able to learn from the experience, take something away from it, learn to make modifications, etc. I want it to have a large user base that is intelligent and can help others learn. I want a flat forum system, using PHP and MySQL.

Read full topic
item.source: Things that bother you about forum software
